data.title: Locking files in node_modules
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 2012 R2

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open project and do some work
2. Update a npm package. e.g. `npm i -D typescript`

It errors with:

``` sh
npm ERR! Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, rename 'E:\hwong\p4\projects\pandash\node_modules\typescript' -> 'E:\hwong\p4\projects\pandash\node_modules\.typescript.DELETE'
```

Once I close VSCode and retry `npm i -D typescript`, it works fine.

data.title: [0.10.12-insider] Debug adapter client doesn't send configurationDone when no breakpoints are registered
data.body:
It appears that the new insider release has changed the startup behavior of the debug adapter client which causes the PowerShell debug adapter to never start executing the script.  We've determined that this is happening because the `configurationDone` request isn't being send when no breakpoints have been created in the Debug workspace.  

Was this intentional?  Should we change the expectations for this request in our code?

See the following bug for more details: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellEditorServices/issues/196
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install PowerShell extension 0.5.0
2. Open folder `c:\Users<username>.vscode-insiders\extension\ms-vscode.PowerShell-0.5.0\examples'
3. Select the `DebugTest.ps1` file
4. Switch to Debug workspace and start the debugger
5. Observe that no output is written and you cannot pause the debugger.  This is because the PowerShell debug adapter never starts executing the script because it didn't receive the configurationDone request.

data.title: translation: translate 'node' as the software product 'node.js' and not as 'knot'
data.body: Example: in "Request '{_request}' was cancelled because node is unresponsive." the word 'node' was translated to 'Knoten' (knot) in German. In the context of VS Code every occurrence of 'node' refers to the product 'Node.js'. I have changed the string in node-debug to use 'Node.js'.

data.title: translation: translate enum values 'scopes' by considering their context
data.body:
The strings below are all variable scopes shown here:

![2016-03-22 18-04-59](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/13960435/abbfad66-f058-11e5-89d0-843eae1d2c14.png)

They should be translated as a whole.

``` json
    "scope.block": "Block",
    "scope.catch": "Catch",
    "scope.closure": "Closure",
    "scope.exception": "Exception",
    "scope.global": "Global",
    "scope.local": "Local",
    "scope.script": "Script",
```

data.title: translation: translate enum values 'stopped reasons' by considering their context
data.body:
The strings below are all the reasons why a debugger is stopped. The 'reason' will be embedded in the string: "Paused on {0}":

![2016-03-22 18-09-08](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/13960579/39ddc40c-f059-11e5-867b-7f1ab7d70f7b.png)

``` json
    "reason.debugger_statement": "debugger statement",
    "reason.breakpoint": "breakpoint",
    "reason.entry": "entry",
    "reason.exception": "exception",
    "reason.step": "step",
    "reason.user_request": "user request",
```

In German there is an inconsistent dot at the end of:

```
    "reason.debugger.statement": "Debuggeranweisung.",
```

data.title: Not receiving configurationDoneRequest when no breakpoints are set
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha 3/22 build
- OS Version: Windows 10 1511

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install Powershell extension and restart
2. Open folder Examples under the Powershell extension install dir
3. Select the DebugTest.ps1 file
4. Press F5 to run, now try to pause the program.  Note that there is no output and pause doesn't work.
5. Now set a line breakpoint and press F5.  Now there is output and pause works.

Our log file shows that when a breakpoint is not set, we do not get the configurationDoneRequest message.  We are counting on getting that message whether there are breakpoints or not.  BTW this is a regression from the currently shipping version of VSCode. 

The debug protocol docs state this:

```
/** ConfigurationDone request; value of command field is "configurationDone".
    The client of the debug protocol must send this request at the end of the sequence of configuration requests (which was started by the InitializedEvent)
*/
```

Am I misreading this?  I believe it implies the configurationDoneRequest message gets sent even if there are no "configuration requests" to send.  But I'm not sure. 

RE https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellEditorServices/issues/196

data.title: Replace dialog opens with the wrong field focused

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11 (commit: f291f4) downloaded today
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In the editor, hit `CTRL-H` for Find & Replace pop-up

Screen grab of the issue:

![test](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2192439/13959231/056f47e4-f019-11e5-8b8f-91bd982e0870.gif)

Issue: Notice the **Find** field should be focused first when the dialog is opened. Instead, the **Replace** field is focused. And `tab` moves the focus forward, to the little icons (one would have to know to `shift-tab` to get back to Find.)

**ETA:** Ah, I suppose this changed at some point, I was comparing 0.10.11 Linux to 0.10.3 Windows.

So it becomes a question of which implementation is "more better". :p :)

Alright, well, here's a list of editor software that focuses the Find input when pressing `Ctrl-H`:
- Microsoft Office
- Google Docs
- GitHub in-browser editor
- Sublime
- Visual Studio 2015 (community / windows)
- Atom 1.5.3

Vs. editors that focus Replace first:
- Atom 1.0.2

Feel free to bring others to my attention.

data.title: Debug type case sensitive
data.body:
_From @rebornix on March 16, 2016 5:19_

While implementing a debug adapter, we need to declare what debug type it is like 

```
"contributes": {
        "debuggers": [
            {
                "type": "Ruby",
                "label": "Ruby Debugger",
                                ...
```

It works perfectly when user set type as `Ruby` in their launch config while it breaks when users type `ruby` with the lowercase `r`. It somewhat confuses users of my tiny plugin. 

Meanwhile if I attempt to change the type value from `Ruby` to `ruby`, my extension will never be backwards-compatible. Is there any solid reason that we make it Case-Sensitive or is there any workaround? You know that we are likely to name our debugger as the language name, `Python` for any python related code, `PowerShell` for ps code, but users might get blocked if they type `python` or `Powershell`.

_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node#15_

data.title: Regression: stdFork patch of fs.writeSync in wrong
data.body:
Spotted by @mattacosta:

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/node/stdForkStart.js#L103

the if check should use && instead

data.title: VS Code Insiders installs always in the OS language despite of language selection during installation
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Download VS Code Insiders from https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders
2. Install using a different language than the OS. (Tested with selecting English and with a Windows 10 in Spanish)
3. Open VS Code Insiders. It will be on your OS language instead of the one you selected.

data.title: Linux: Changes to process.env from main are not reaching renderer

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Related to #4558

We do a good job in getting the user environment and injecting that all the way to the renderer, but we fail to pick up the actual process.env as it exists on the main side.

The code is in: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/electron-main/main.ts#L250

Imho if we want to make sure that process.env travels to renderer and its forked processes, we need to capture the environment as late as possible before opening a new window and merge both user environment and process.environment at that time.

@joaomoreno thoughts?

data.title: Fixes #4558: process.env['VSCODE_NLS_CONFIG'] set in main.js will not reach renderer under Linux
process.env['VSCODE_NLS_CONFIG'] set in main.js will not reach renderer under Linux
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  in main.js write to the process.env (see VSCODE_NLS_CONFIG)
2. the environment variable will not reach the renderer process

data.title: Make explorer keybindings configurable
data.body:
**Status**
Please see https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4557#issuecomment-276960041 for a list of available commands and contexts for explorer and opened editors view commands.

**Original Description:**
- VSCode Version:  0.10.11
- OS Version: Mac 10.11.3

When the explorer is in focus, hitting `ctrl+enter` will open the selected file to the side, but as far as I can tell, there isn't a keybinding to simply open the selected file (`enter` on its own will trigger renaming the file and `+enter` doesn't do anything).

data.title: node-debug lacks translations for package.json
data.body: node-debug lacks translations for package.json

data.title: [var] keyword is also highlighted in any word starting with 'var...'
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set the "Language Mode" to "Javascript"
2. Write "variable", you'll see that the prefix "var" is highlighted

This doesn't happen when the word starting with "var" is part of a function argument, or inside strings
*Tried with multiple themes, issues seems to be theme-agnostic (happens on all of them)

![variables](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5549335/13951630/ed72bd52-f03a-11e5-9131-cd55a0938c7f.png)

data.title: StandaloneCodeEditor throws exceptions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: February
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Try to create an editor in browser via Monaco.Editor.create() or StandaloneCodeEditor.create() 
2. There will be a lot of errors like "standaloneCodeEditor.js:34 Could not instantiate contribution editor.action.insertLineAfter" in browser console

data.title: There is no way to use FindController in minified distro
data.body:
- VSCode Version: February
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. run "gulp editor-distro" in vscode folder.
2. try to force editor to open Find/Replace window. There is no same way

data.title: [ESLint] Configuration descriptions need localization.
data.body:
OS: windows10
VSCode build: 0.10.12-alpha

Steps:
1. Launch app from command prompt by targeting any supported locale.

> code-alpha --locale=ko
> 2. Go to file-> Preference->Workspace settings->
> 3. Verify default setting file contents.

Actual: ESLint section is not localized and displaying in English irrespective of targeted locale.
Expected: ESLint contents inside default setting file should be localized.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13947147/fd3e2678-efd5-11e5-993c-83139419cf2e.png)
